name: GIM Lab
summary: Lab to teach you how the GIM schema and normalization work

title.@value: Pi-hole Lab
Pi-hole Lab

description.@value: All processing related to the Pi-hole Lab

source.@value:
pipeline "Pi-hole Lab"
stage 0 match either
stage 5 match pass
rule "05 - Parse - Pi-hole Lab- Split message into initial fields"
stage 10 match pass
rule "10 - Parse - Pi-hole Lab - Split message into additional fields"
stage 20 match pass
stage 15 match pass
rule "Parse - Pi-hole Unattached - Drop irrelevant messages"
end

pipeline "Pi-hole Enhanced"
stage 3 match pass
rule "Parse - Pi-hole Enhanced - Split messages into initial fields"
stage 6 match pass

stage 9 match pass

rule "Parse - Pi-hole Enhanced - Gravity tracking"
rule "Parse - Pi-hole Enhanced - Parsing pihole_action for additional fields"
stage 24 match pass
rule "Parse - Pi-hole Enhanced - Parse for additional fields in query_action"
rule "Parse - Pi-hole Enhanced - Parse for destination_ip"
rule "GeoIP lookup: external ip"
stage 27 match pass
rule "NML - Pi-hole Enhanced - NML for pihole_action again"
rule "NML - Pi-hole Enhanced - NML pihole_action one last time"
stage 30 match pass

stage 33 match pass
rule "Parse - Pi-hole Enhanced - Parse IP one last time"
rule "GeoIP lookup: external ip"
stage 40 match pass
rule "Parse - Pi-hole Unattached - Drop irrelevant messages"
stage 0 match pass
end

summary.@value: Searches related to the Pi-hole Lab

title.@value: Pi-hole Lab
NML - FW/WFW - Normalize 'ALLOW' in action field

source.@value:
rule "NML - FW/WFW - Normalize 'ALLOW' in action field"

when
    $message.action == "ALLOW"
then
    set_field("action","pass");
    set_field("parse", "NML - FW/WFW - Normalize 'ALLOW' in action field");
end

title.@value: Parse - Pi-hole Unattached - Parse pihole_action field
NML - FW/OPN - Normalize protoname field

summary.@value: A dashboard displaying info about Pi-hole

title.@value: Pi-hole Enhanced
Pi-hole Enhanced

description.@value: The tag must match 'Pi-hole' for the messages to be routed to this stream
All messages related to Pi-hole Enhanced

title.@value: Pi-hole Lab

description.@value: If the incoming message matches the specific tag then we route it to this Pi-hole Lab stream
All messages related to the Pi-hole Lab

title.@value: Parse - Pi-hole Unattached - Drop irrelevant messages

source.@value:
rule "Parse - Pi-hole Unattached - Drop irrelevant messages"

when
    starts_with(to_string($message.pihole_message), "read /etc/") OR 
    starts_with(to_string($message.pihole_message), "using only") OR
    starts_with(to_string($message.pihole_message), "failed to load names") OR
    starts_with(to_string($message.pihole_message), "using nameserver ") OR
    starts_with(to_string($message.pihole_message), "compile time options") OR
    starts_with(to_string($message.pihole_message), "DNS service limited") OR
    starts_with(to_string($message.pihole_message), "started, version ") OR
    starts_with(to_string($message.pihole_message), "exiting on receipt")
then
    set_field("parse","Parse - Pi-hole Unattached - Drop irrelevant messages");
    drop_message();
end

title.@value: Normalization - Firewall Events Lab

description.@value: All processing related to firewalls happens here

source.@value:
pipeline "Normalization - Firewall Events Lab"
stage 0 match either
stage 3 match pass
rule "Parse - FW/OPN - Split into initial fields"
stage 6 match pass
rule "Parse - FW/WFW - Split into additional fields"
stage 9 match pass
rule "Route - Route messages to Firewall Events Lab stream"
stage 15 match pass
stage 12 match pass
end

title.@value: 10 - Parse - Pi-hole Lab - Split message into additional fields

description.@value: This rule uses a custom grok pattern titled 'PIHOLELAB' and if  the pattern matches, it sets some additional fields.

title.@value: 05 - Parse - Pi-hole Lab- Split message into initial fields

description.@value: This rules always executes since we want every one of our messages to have the pid (process id) and start with the beginnings of the pihole_action value in the message field. If a grok pattern matches syslog timestamp, a word, positive integer, and greedydata we set the initial fields of timestamp, application_name, pid, and message.

title.@value: GeoIP lookup: external ip
Parse - Pi-hole Enhanced - Gravity tracking
Parse - Pi-hole Enhanced - Parsing pihole_action for additional fields
Parse - Pi-hole Enhanced - Parsing pihole_action field
NML - Pi-hole Enhanced - Normalize pihole_action field
Parse - Pi-hole Enhanced - Parse for destination_ip
Parse - Pi-hole Enhanced - Parse for internal_ip

source.@value:
rule "Parse - Pi-hole Enhanced - Parse for internal_ip"
when
    cidr_match("192.168.0.0/16", to_ip($message.IP)) ||
    cidr_match("172.16.0.0/12", to_ip($message.IP)) ||
    cidr_match("10.0.0.0/8", to_ip($message.IP))
then
    set_field("internal_ip", true);
    set_field("parse", "Parse - Pi-hole Enhanced - Parse for internal_ip");
end

title.@value: Parse - Pi-hole Enhanced - Parsing pihole_result field
Parse - Pi-hole Enhanced - Parse pihole_response field for IPORHOST
Parse - Pi-hole Enhanced - Splitting into additional fields
Parse - Pi-hole Enhanced - Parse IP one last time

source.@value:
rule "Parse - Pi-hole Enhanced - Parse IP one last time"
when
    $message.internal_ip == false && $message.pihole_context == "is" && $message.pihole_action == "blacklisted" OR 
    $message.internal_ip == false && $message.pihole_context == "is" && $message.pihole_action == "blocked"
then
    remove_field("internal_ip");
    set_field("parse","Parse - Pi-hole Enhanced - Parse IP one last time");
end

title.@value: Parse - Pi-hole Enhanced - Parse for internal_ip again
Parse - Pi-hole Enhanced - Parse pihole_response field
Parse - Pi-hole Enhanced - Parsing for 'query' in pihole_action
NML - Pi-hole Enhanced - NML pihole_action one last time
Parse - Pi-hole Enhanced - Split messages into initial fields
Parse - Pi-hole Enhanced - Parse for additional fields in query_action
NML - Pi-hole Enhanced - NML for pihole_action again
Parse - FW/WFW - Split into additional fields
Route - Route messages to Firewall Events Lab stream

source.@value:
rule "Route - Route messages to Firewall Events Lab stream"

when
    has_field("tos")
then
    route_to_stream("Firewall Events Lab");
    set_field("parse", "Route - Route messages to Firewall Events Lab stream");
end
